intro: Hieracium rohacsense subsp. gletschense, commonly known as the Gletsch Hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish to orange-colored flowers. The leaves are typically basal and hairy, with a rough texture. This subspecies is native to alpine regions of Europe, particularly in the Alps and Carpathians. It thrives in rocky and dry habitats, often found in high-altitude meadows and slopes.
